paper_abstract: It is shown that, a recursive equation X =(RS) t(X) in the LLTS-oriented process calculus CLLR may have more than one consistent solution when X occurs in the scope of a conjunction in t(X), and the recursive term (X vertical bar X = t(X)) is the greatest solution of this equation w.r.t Luttgen and Vogler's ready simulation whenever X is strongly guarded in t(X). (C) 2015 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: On the greatest solution of equations in CLLR
